Reviews.Title: High promises-Low deliverance
Reviews.Author: Nadav
Reviews.Content: The camera feels great and easy to use. As all Fuji cameras (and I had few) it is very user friendly. The quality of photos and movies is second to none and you can take clips of HD and great photos especially with the automatic mode set.There were however 3 very disappointing points which we did not expected and are important to highlight:1. Most important - batteries. The camera has a unique battery that runs empty in minutes (even when GPS location search is permanently off. It would be easier if the camera simply was using AA batteries.2. GPS location - when on the result is just a sheet with latitudes and longitudes and we are still trying to figure out how to tag the photos with real places names.3. Clips - while zooming in/out while recording a clip/movie there are two problems: loosing focus and hearing the zoom action in the movie.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Scott K. "Sk"
Reviews.Content: I just moved to Colorado and this is the first camera I have purchased.I chose it because I will be doing a lot of outdoor activities and this one seemed to have all the functions I would need to be satisfied.First test was taking it on a 3 day ski trip with my friends and it performed beautifully.  I was taking pictures and videos on and off for about 8 hrs each day.  The battery ran out the first day, but only towards the very end of the day after a lot of video and pictures being taken.  I would recommend bringing an extra battery just in case, I did and it worked out great.I was in 20 degree weather the whole time and they say the batteries do worse in cold weather, so I can only imagine how they will perform in optimum conditions.The pictures and videos came out great...only problem with uploading the videos was the sound would not transfer over, but I believe it has something to do with a codec on Divx and will be fixed soon.I crashed pretty hard while taking video with the camera and there wasn't even a scratch on it.  It looks like brand new after 3 hard days on the mountain and I would definitely recommend this camera for someone looking for a solid piece of equipment.

Reviews.Title: I really Like this Camera
Reviews.Author: Buy Once Cry Once
Reviews.Content: I had this on my wishlist and received it as a gift. I looked at other outdoor cameras and based on reviews didn't see why I would want others at double the price (Pentax)when reviewers had the same gripes  and complaints. Those complaints were mostly about water submersion issues, which i tested at home. I ran the camera under a faucet and let it dry. The camera still works. Hopefully that means I will have no issues.I chose the orange color to make it easy to find and stand out from the typical black. I love the color, it looks like a search and rescue orange and fits the outdoor look.The body has a nice metal front, solid rubber coating for grip, and is larger than the last model. I like the size since I get clumsy with electronics and like a bigger size. Picture quality so far has been very nice, crisp and clear. The settings are relatively simple though I have not tried them all.One added feature on this model is the GPS locator. It will stamp each picture with a GPS coordinate, for example if you are on a road trip and not completely sure where you are. Doesn't sound like much, but when you download hundreds or thousands of pics from a trip i bet you don't remember where every picture was taken. I could also see some use if you were to get lost; maybe you don't know where you are, take a picture and look at its grid coordinates, you could tell help those coordinates. Doubtful the feature will get used much but its there should i need it.Just to compare to the last model, someone I know has it. The last model was smaller, lacked the GPS, and seemed more prone to water damage. Apparently, there is a fine not able to see coat of plastic over the camera which seals it. In salt water, and from any kind of detergents or cleaning products, that coating dissolves making the camera no longer water proof. Well you don't know this until it happens, and Fuji will refuse the warranty. So in other words don't expect Fuji to back the warranty. Be very careful with your camera, and try to let it dry completely before opening the battery/memory compartment. I think i will begin carrying a small terry towel which is super absorbent to wipe the camera with after any water use.So far I love the camera and hope it lasts for years.

Reviews.Title: This is not a waterproof camera
Reviews.Author: janita
Reviews.Content: I went to the river and big disapoointment: as soon I took a picture under the water (just about 5 inches under it) it stopped working and a couple hours later there was moist into the screen. The camera continue working after a few hours. I took it back to the store. The battery has also a short life, I was taking the charger with my everywhere.

Reviews.Title: Decent pictures but needs improvement overall
Reviews.Author: Curtis Jones
Reviews.Content: As far as being waterproof and having an integrated GPS (two of the main reasons I purchased this camera), it is excellent. Additionally, the picture quality is acceptable. However, it has two major short-comings. First, the camera can be turned on accidentally far too easily (when in a pocket). When I'm on a long mountain climbing trip and battery life is carefully planned, I can't have the camera randomly turning on because it got jostled slightly. Second, it can't be charged via USB. In other words, you either have to have an AC outlet or spare batteries. You can't rely on bring a larger battery to charge the electrical devices; and you can't rely on a solar panel (again, without an AC converter).In summary: for an every-day camera, it's perfectly fine. If the rugged and waterproof nature of the camera is important, consider the shortcomings before making the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Get to Maui, get in water, not waterproof
Reviews.Author: R. Taylor Weber "portlandia911"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera specifically for the trip I'm on right now...in Maui.  I received it back in mid March and never thought to test it's waterproof capabilities because friends of mine have similar models and rave about their cameras.  Well I'm here on vacation now, the sole purpose of buying the camera, and on it's maiden voyage into the ocean it didn't stay waterproofed and never worked.  My friends here with me also have a similar model and pointed out the battery/memory card compartment on mine closes very easily while theirs takes some extra effort to close.  So their theory is the gasket on mine was never good enough.  The salt water got into it so badly that it won't do anything now.  I don't know yet if it ruined the memory card I also bought through Amazon but that's going to upset me more if it doesn't work.  So here I am...on my biggest vacation of the year...with no camera, let alone a waterproof one that was supposed to capture all my most unique adventures.  My heart is breaking.  Not one underwater shot.How to return this?  Well I bought this on 3/15/12 and the first Amazon message I run into when clicking the button to return it is that my return window expired on 4/17/12.  Wow...thanks for the second low blow since today is 5/5/12.  I'm going to keep the faith that when I get home I will find a way to return or exchange this item to make an attempt at reversing the damage done.  This is the second electronics item I have bought through Amazon that has failed me.  If I cannot get my money back, or receive a camera that is waterproof, I will never buy another electronic item through Amazon again.So the lesson learned here is to test the waterproofing as soon as you get this, if you choose to buy this camera for water-resistant adventures.  Maybe even test it a few times within your 30 day return window.

Reviews.Title: Bad manufacture
Reviews.Author: Adriana L. Del Portillo
Reviews.Content: This camera took some wonderful photos. But the latch for the battery never would close properly and apparently the inside isn't waterproof. Fuji doesn't fix cameras so that $200 down the drain :(

Reviews.Title: Don't buy this camera!!!
Reviews.Author: soccer hooligan
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera through Amazon Wharehouse and it lasted about 2 1/2 months before leaking. The camera is worthless and Amazon only had a return time period of one month. Fuji does not cover warranties from non-authorized sellers.The pics I got to take when it was working were mostly decent, although not consistently so. If you decide to buy a waterproof camera, do not do it through Amazon as their return policy is way too short.

Reviews.Title: Worked fine then leaked. Does not appear to be really water tight
Reviews.Author: Lauriston Izlar
Reviews.Content: I bought this to film under water for our whirlpool bath product line for a promotion film I was working on. It worked the first two times and then leaked on the third day of use. We were only filming at 19 inches deep and the quality of the video was excellent until the camera flooded. I would not recommend this if you really want water proof unless this was just a fluke or bad camera. My previous experience with Fugi digitals has been excellent. In fact I prefer them over Canon and Nikon for inexpensive cameras. I am including some of the video we shot

Reviews.Title: Very Upset with the results... Maybe a lemmon, but it broke on the first try
Reviews.Author: Tribal Plague "BOFH"
Reviews.Content: For the record, I own a Fujifilm FinePix S1500 10MP Digital Camera with 12x Wide Angle Dual Image Stabilized Optical Zoom and it works great.  I am not biased at Fuji, but I'm pissed off because mother's day was ruined.I purchased The Fujifilm Finepix XP30, because in all the reviews it showed it to be a good camera for the price and its capabilities.  This camera was my fiance's mother's day present... (Which incidentally its TODAY).We had been playing with the camera and it was working great, I found the GPS Utility to be rather annoying as it took close to 1minute and sometimes more,  to find the GPS satellite everytime we turned on the camera...  Even in open areas OUTSIDE.  My 7yrs old GPS is faster than that.The battery like many others have pointed out lasts close to nothing when you have the GPS always on feature, and even with it off, it doesnt last a lot.Today at some point, our daughter got her feet on the pool and I wanted to show off the camera underwater.  I put the camera around 6 inches under the surface when I saw bubbles come from the black hump where the gps antenna is... it was not a train of bubbles either, but enough to concern you a bit, I  snapped photo of her feet underwater and took it out, then showed it to my fiance, up til then the camera was working great.I switched the Always ON of the GPS, to see if it minimized the connection setting every time we turned on the camera, and turned it off.  We got home and when I went to turn it on, I get greeted by a white screen and then 10s later it turned off.  The screen started getting this weird off-screen glare (you can see it here: [...]) I thought maybe the battery ran out, but then I put it, to charge and gave it a good charge until the light was green and I tried again to turn it on.  It was as if the camera got possessed. It starting flashing the screen, white and with scan lines... the menu button didnt work, a total mess.  I opened the battery compartment and I checked the battery bay and the camera was wet, but when I took the memory card out, that is when we saw the camera was not slightly wet, but it had globs of water.I got the SD card out and its wet.  The camera did take water and its not supposed to... I remember al the lids where shut tight, but somehow it got wet.  I'ts not that it got wet because I dived 20feet either... The camera was merely 6 inches at the most under water.Aside from it not working as advertised, the delivery got thwarted because amazon shipped with UPS, which is like the Incompetents of the carrier and shipping industry.  We live in Dallas, and the camera per the tracking, arrived here, then somehow it shipped itself to Ontario California, and no one in amazon or UPS knew why.  So I ordered through prime and instead of it arriving two days as most of my stuff arrives it took a week.So Fuji with the XP30 didnt build a Waterproof Camera, they built a camera that boasts it being water, shock, snow and dust proof, but it really cant take 6 inches of depth.Now I have to figure if Amazon is going to make the return or if I have to deal with Fujifilm for it...I am giving the camera an overall rating of 1 star, because it turned on.  But the fact that it got water in  just took away the rest of the stars, I could give it a 2 star rating but, the GPS taking 2hrs to boot in took away that star as well.Amazon's ratings never fail, I should have listened when some people  complained about the quality of this camera.... :(

Reviews.Title: I want a new one :(
Reviews.Author: vero_nitrox
Reviews.Content: The camera was excellent, but hard a week stopped working because the cover was closed but not with the lock and we submerged, does not work more.The photos were very good, the videos were fine.

Reviews.Title: Perfect purchase for our cruise!
Reviews.Author: Rusty
Reviews.Content: I have a normal digital camera but bought this one so I would be OK with it getting wet. I don't think I even used my regular camera the entire time. I strapped this camera to my wrist and went snorkeling, diving, swam with dolphins and even sting rays. All of the other people were asking about the camera getting wet, but I assured them that it was fine. Each night I uploaded the pics from the camera (just in case I lost it, I would have the pics taken so far on my laptop.) The pictures taken out of the water were just as good if not better than my regular digital camera, but the pictures taken underwater were amazing. I will post a couple of them to show the camera's quality.When I purchased this, it came with a carrying case, tripod, 2GB memory card, memory card USB adapter, battery charger, and little 6" tripod. Everything was included, and I never even had to buy a better memory. 2GB is plenty for a seven day cruise.I really wanted the blue colored camera, and I think I paid a little extra for it, but I have no regrets. This has become our primary camera to bring everywhere (when we remember) because it is so durable and its OK if we drop in in water (or more likely, spill beer on it).Oh, I also recorded a movie of my fianc3 swimming with a dolphin and it came out just as good as the pictures.This camera says that it was refurbished but I cannot tell. It looks and works like it was brand new. That may change by seller, but I could not be happier with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Cam - Short Battery life
Reviews.Author: doglover4life
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!! And others do too it would seem, seeing as my first one got stolen :(I used it all day at a water park, got great video of water slides and with the neoprene case that comes with it it was so handy to keep on your person all day. I clipped it onto my swim suit, and it got dragged through water, went on water slides, and all was good, until it got snatched :(However towards the end of the day I did realize that the battery was running low after only a couple videos (30 seconds max) and about 40 or so photos. But I am not sure if that is because I forgot to turn it off or something.As for the comments saying it is not water proof, I think the water proof technology is rather new for digital cameras, and I believe that we are not completely aware as consumers of how to make sure that the case is locked and ready to go. Read all instructions is my best advice. I had no issues at all.I loved this camera so much, I bought another as soon as I got home from my vacation! This time I went with Orange instead of Green, but I think I prefer the green to the orange.It is a great snap and shoot camera. Nothing extravagant, just nice, compact, and ready for fun :)

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: vin
Reviews.Content: First time I got camera wet, it stopped working.  I seen water all in the screen.  I ended up returning it.  Don't recomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: The older model was better....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had the older version of this camera for years. I took it snorkeling, surfing, boating, hiking, everywhere. It was stolen at a birthday party :( Of course, after years of use it was a little worn, I'm not easy on electronics. It was still water tight and taking great pictures.The new model is attractive and as user friendly as the old one. I am currently shopping for a new underwater camera due to the simple fact that this camera is NOT water tight. The latch is difficult, finicky and is prone to getting stuck. I have already had the camera replaced once just to have the same thing happen again, this is after less than a year of ownership. My last camera lasted for 3 years!

Reviews.Title: Not Waterproof! I am on my 3rd one
Reviews.Author: A. Parr
Reviews.Content: This camera has some really cool features, which is why I couldn't justify giving it only 1 star, however, the quality of the camera itself is not very good at all, which is why I give only 2 stars. I just received my 3rd Fuji XP30, after having to return the first 2 after they stopped working. I bought this camera because I needed something that was going to be a good, hardy travel camera. The first time I used the camera in the water, while snorkelling, it stopped working (the LCD screen got flooded and went black, and since there is no manual view finder, the camera is useless without the LCD screen). So, I sent it to Fuji under the 1 year warranty (at my expense of course). They promptly sent me a new one, although not in the original color that I bought. I hoped this was just a fluke, but less than 4 months later, the new camera got wet while I was on a very wet motorcycle trip through the rainforest (this time the zoom and some of the other buttons stopped working). I had to buy a new camera in the middle of my trip, and then also sent this camera back to Fuji at my expense. They determined that this camera also stopped working due to water damage.  They claim the camera is waterproof up to 5 meters, but both of these cameras stopped working at the slightest bit of contact with water, so I can't imagine how it survive actually being submerged up to 5m! I just received my replacement for the last one...maybe 3rd time is a charm, but I am already expecting to have to send this one back too!

Reviews.Title: xp30
Reviews.Author: steven
Reviews.Content: I bought this because of my work location - with the sand storm - so for so good it workd great for the money I paid I am please.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Debora Carpentieri
Reviews.Content: I love my camera!I can take pictures under water.I can edit the pictures in the camera.I love it!

Reviews.Title: Waterproof camera doesn't work when it gets wet!
Reviews.Author: Ta-Ta
Reviews.Content: This is the second camera with the same problem.  It stops working when it gets even though it is listed as waterproof.I'll go with Nikon next round.

Reviews.Title: Great Little Camera
Reviews.Author: Cynthia
Reviews.Content: We bought this because our other underwater camera broke. While we haven't had too many opportunities to use this in water, we have used it around water and at other events. It is very durable and takes great pictures! The features are easy to use. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone--especially those with children, as it would be great to have at water parks, the beach, or a pool.

Reviews.Title: Buena
Reviews.Author: Antonny Rincones
Reviews.Content: La cámara es decente en cuanto a las toma, sobretodo en ambientes de mucha luz.Bajo el agua también quedan bien las fotos.

Reviews.Title: excelent
Reviews.Author: Maurcapy
Reviews.Content: Excelent product good quality, the shipping excelent, and the description is really like the publication, i am happy with my order and everything is excelent

Reviews.Title: Fujifilm XP20
Reviews.Author: Marcus Henauth
Reviews.Content: Ótima máquina a prova de água... Mas esse modelo não tem uma boa definição de fotos. Obs.: digo isso em comparação ao modelo anterior a xp20.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed, took in water after only the second use.
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Ewing
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera in November 2011, and have used it snorkeling only twice, the second time it took on water and no longer works.

Reviews.Title: Not bad, but not great
Reviews.Author: Renaissance Man
Reviews.Content: Good quality photos and good battery life; easy to use, packs well and is durable. However, there are some significant liabilities.The GPS feature takes forever to find the signal and sucks up battery power. The GPS feature was one of the main reasons for purchasing the camera, but its performance has been disappointing.The lens is unprotected and located such that it's easy to get your finger in a number of shots.The side battery door needs to be carefully closed, since the locking slide doesn't always catch as it should.

Reviews.Title: No water resistant, not turn on
Reviews.Author: antonioroa
Reviews.Content: bad, It is a lie what the waterproof not water resistant. No water resistant, digital camera that does not meet the advertised trade, does not work well under water and then the water enters the inside and stops working no water resistant

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA, NOT WATERPROOF
Reviews.Author: walter
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because my kids love waterparks and beaches. The camera didnt last a day. As soon as I took it to the beach into the water,  it stop working within 30min. Water had seeped into it. Got home called Fuji was informed to find reciept.  I see a big lawsuit for false advertisement.  What if i cant find receipt.

Reviews.Title: Leaked the first time I used it in the pool.
Reviews.Author: Owens Mom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my daughter to use because it was supposed to be a sturdy waterproof camera. Well, the first thing I noticed when we got it was that the door on the side where you insert the battery and SD card doesn't close well at all. You close it and it pops open about 4 or 5 times before you can get it to stay closed. We decided to keep the camera anyway, even though the photos were average at best. We have 2 older models of this camera and have never had them leak or take bad photos. Finally the warm weather came and I took it into the pool to take pictures of the kids underwater. I held it in my hands about 4 inches below the water level and was taking pictures when it just started turning on and off. I looked at the camera and noticed a bit of water under the screen on the back. Within minutes the camera shut off for the final time and the entire back screen, flash, and lens were wet inside. That was the end of the camera. Now I have to pay to send this back to Fuji in hopes that the next one won't leak. Not a happy customer!

Reviews.Title: To Antarctica and Back! (And All the places in between)
Reviews.Author: Asa Li
Reviews.Content: I took this camera with me on my adventure to Antarctica simply because it was a reasonably priced, highly rated, freeze proof camera with decent MP and zoom (the other features came as a bonus). Yes it is "freeze proof" only rated to 14F, while I was in much colder temps (-20F), it lasted far longer than anyone else's 'regular' camera battery life. I carried this thing with me everywhere surviving every drop I put it through and it resisted the clingy dust and dirt that lingered everywhere from work outside.However, I did take it to the beach in Hawaii and the sand did not pass the test with the sand. Grains of sand worked their way underneath the shutter button. It did eventually fall out and everything was fine.I have taken it in the water multiple times both the ocean and lakes and it has been fine every time taking great underwater pictures.Video is ok. It won't be 1080 hd video by any means but when I replay it on my comp, it comes out like it was filmed 20 years ago (poor lighting quality) and you can hear the zoom clicking on the video. I wasn't that impressed.Pictures come out fine but there is no wow factor by clarity. You just have to remember you get what you pay for.Overall, this camera is durable and resistent to the elements and falls. I was impressed by that. Picture quality is decent, not "wowing". Video is poor quality.The thing I like the most about this camera is the durability! Antarctic tested and proven tough. Although I could do with better quality in video and pictures.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: jenheroux
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for our family trip to Atlantis - worked awesome!  Our 8 & 9 year old had no problem using it.  Video taped themselves going down all the water slides and the rapids.  Great video and pictures taken underwater at the beach, pool, and feeding the sting rays.  Would not recommend as your primary camera though because it does hesitate a little before it takes the picture so you may miss a fast moving shot

Reviews.Title: Fuji quality
Reviews.Author: Sally Micucci "Sally Micucci"
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd fuji film fine pix; My daughter has the first one, and I realized that I wasn't happy with out one... The shooting options are easy to switch between and give good quality photo's. Download (to a mac) very easy. I love the waterproof & dust options as it allows us to take photo's what ever the weather with out having to hide the camera until the weather has passed!

Reviews.Title: Great outdoors camera, great price!
Reviews.Author: Amarillys Ojeda
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a gift for my 16 yr old son. He's an outdoors guy and loves it so far. Resolution on the pictures is amazing !

Reviews.Title: GPS Plus
Reviews.Author: Cheryl Markos
Reviews.Content: I ordered this simply because it has the GPS along with the water proof features. I kayak the lagoons and Everglades of Florida and it's easy to not have a clue which way is back to the camp or boat launch. I will take a picture of where I launch and use it to find my way back.When the camera arrives and if it works, I'll update my review. But, all of this for $135 dollars, you got to be kidding. I have a Fuji camera for above water it is awesome.Tight lines!

Reviews.Title: Audio is out-of-sync
Reviews.Author: H. Wang "jwangamazon"
Reviews.Content: I got the Fuji XP20 mainly for taking videos in conditions that my Canon HD camcorder can not. On my first usage in a river rafting event, I already see the problems with this camera:1) I am experienced with Camera and camcorders, I know how to hold them properly. But the lens head is placed in a very awkward place, your fingers will easily cover part of the lens head. So, don't be surprised to see your fingers in the final photos and video clips. It's almost for sure that you will not get photos or videos of yourself. Because other people may not be able to hold this camera properly to take yours.2) Hard to fine tune the zoom speed. Not convenient, but I can live with that.3) The camera won't focus while zooming (it will focus after zooming stops). This is a typical issue with non-DSLR camera in video mode. I saw the same thing in Panasonic camera also. Not a big issue to me.4) This is the biggest flaw, the audio is not in sync with the video. I have to turn off the audio from the video clips, and add background music when producing the final movie for the rafting trip. Even my simple Flip video camera handle this better than this Fuji camera.5) The video quality is no way to compare with regular HD camcorder. The image is kind of grainy, even at 1pm strong sunshine with good light. Again, I can accept this since I am in a condition (around water) where normal camcorder can not be used.6) Indoor photo quality is no way to compare with my 5-year-old 5MP Panasonic camera.But this is OK to me since I am in a condition (around water) where my normal camera can not be used.If this is the only camera you want to have, I won't recommend this. However, if your intend is "ONLY" to take photos, videos in conditions where your normal gears can not, then I think this Fuju XP20 is acceptable....if you don't mind the out-of-sync audio problem.

Reviews.Title: Terrible! Broke the first time I put it in water.
Reviews.Author: Taylor
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for our cruise and I made sure to follow the instructions. The first time I dipped it into the water to test it out, the camera completely shut off. A little bit later we noticed fog (water) behind the lens. I definitely do not recommend this camera to anyone. It was so dissapointing that I lost out on so many pictures I wanted to take of swimming with the dolphins and more. I wouldn't take the chance on purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect little camera
Reviews.Author: Savhsu
Reviews.Content: I purchased the fujifilm finepix xp30 after damaging an earlier version without shock resistance.  The first fujifilm waterproof camera I dropped & caused a corner to break so no longer waterproof but still works perfectly otherwise.  The new xp30 is perfect!!  Takes extraordinary pics, withstands abuse & water.  Wouldn't trade up.  For the price & performance the Fujifilm XP30 can't be beat!!

Reviews.Title: full of water!!
Reviews.Author: Borelly
Reviews.Content: i WAS VERY PLEASED WITH MY CAMERA, I TOOK IT TO A TRIP TO THE BEACH, MADE SOME GOOD UNDERWATER SCENES ON A POOL AND SEA,  BUT I SAW SOME MOISTURE ON THE SCREEN... A MONTH LATER I WENT TO A POOL, AND...GAME OVER...FULL OF WATER, COMPLETELY WASHED UP. NEVER TURN ON AGAIN, A PIECE OF JUNK.  LOST MY MONEY..IT WAS NEW! : (

ProductInfo.Features:
14.0 Megapixel
5X Wide Zoom (28-140Mm)
2.7" LCD Screen
4-Way Protection
Gps Technology With Geo-Tagging
14-megapixel CCD sensor; 5x wide-angle optical zoom
Rugged design is waterproof, shockproof, freezeproof, and dustproof
GPS Geo-tagging function; easy Web upload to Facebook and YouTube
HD video capture; 720p with sound at 30 frames per second with one-touch ease
Capture images and video to SD/SDHC memory cards (not included)
ProductInfo.Name: Fujifilm FinePix XP30 14 MP Waterproof Digital Camera with Fujinon 5x Optical Zoom Lens and GPS Geo-Tagging Function (Orange)
